page.title: South Carolina Gamecocks women's track and field

revisions.rev:
{{Infobox college track and field team |name = South Carolina Gamecocks |logo = South Carolina Gamecocks Block C logo.svg |logo_size = |university = University of South Carolina |conference = Southeastern Conference |conference_short = SEC |division = |city = Columbia |stateabb = SC |state = South Carolina |coach = [[Curtis Frye]] |tenure = 12th |indoortrack = [[USC Indoor Facility]] |outdoortrack = [[Weems Baskin Track Facility]] |nickname = [[South Carolina Gamecocks|Gamecocks]] |color1 = Garnet |color2 = Black |color3 = |fontcolor = ffffff |hex1 = 8C2633 |hex2 = 000000 |hex3 = |NCAAindoorchampion = |NCAAoutdoorchampion = 2002 |NCAAindoortourneys = 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010 |NCAAoutdoortourneys = 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009 |conference_indoor = |conference_outdoor = 1999, 2002, 2005 }} The '''[[South Carolina Gamecocks]] women's [[track and field]] team''' represents the [[University of South Carolina]] and competes in the [[Southeastern Conference]]. The team has been coached by [[Curtis Frye]] since 1997. Several Olympic medalists have been a part of the program, such as [[Aleen Bailey]] and [[Tonique Williams-Darling]]. ==Year-by-Year Results==
